statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UC Santa Barbara 70, Pacific 62
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- Alex Harris scored a game-high 27 points, and UC Santa Barbara held off a late rally to beat Pacific 70-62 in a Big West Conference game Saturday night. Santa Barbara, which led by 20 points three separate times in the second half, saw its lead cut to 62-59 with 43 seconds remaining. But the Gauchos made 8 of 10 free throws in the final 39 seconds to beat Pacific for the first time since 2003. Justin Joyner and Chris Devine each scored 10 points for Santa Barbara (13-6, 5-2 Big West), which led 57-40 with seven minutes remaining before Pacific began its comeback. Solomon HorseChief scored 17 points to lead Pacific (7-12, 3-3). Reggie Vezia had 13 points for the Tigers and Steffan Johnson scored 12. A 3-pointer by Johnson and three free throws by HorseChief brought Pacific within three points in the final minute, but the Tigers couldn't convert the next time they had the ball and Santa Barbara sealed the victory with free throws. Both teams made their first three shots from the field, and Santa Barbara made six of its first seven on its way to shooting 61 percent in the first half. The Gauchos twice built a 10-point lead, then had a late 8-0 run before settling for a 32-23 halftime lead. HorseChief had three 3-pointers in the first half and Vezia had two to keep Pacific in the game.
